title: Matrikas
summary: Matrikas (Sanskrit: मातृका (singular), IAST: mātṝkās, lit. "divine mothers")[2] also called Matar or Matri, are a group of mother goddesses who are always depicted together in Hinduism. The Matrikas are often depicted in a group of seven, the Saptamatrika(s) (Seven Mothers).[3] However, they are also depicted as a group of eight, the Ashtamatrika(s).[4]
